refnamediv.refpurpose: standard deviation (row orcolumn-wise) of vector/matrix entries

refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: y = stdev(x) y = stdev(x, '*') y = stdev(x, 'r'|1) y = stdev(x, 'c'|2) y = stdev(x, orien, m)

listitem.para: "*" (default), "r" or 1, "c" or 2, or 0<integer<=ndims(x): direction along which calculations are performed.
real scalar, vector or hypermatrix, the a priori mean

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: stdev computes the "sample" standard deviation, that is, it is normalized by N-1, where N is the sequence length. If m is present, then stdev computes the mean squared deviation (normalized by N) using the a priori mean defined by m.
For a vector or a matrix x, y=stdev(x) returns in the scalar y the standard deviation of all the entries of x.
y=stdev(x,'r') (or, equivalently, y=stdev(x,1)) is the rowwise standard deviation. It returns in each entry of the row vector y the standard deviation of each column of x.
y=stdev(x,'c') (or, equivalently, y=stdev(x,2)) is the columnwise stdev. It returns in each entry of the column vector y the standard deviation of each row of x.
By extension, y=stdev(x,n) with n a positive integer returns the deviation along the n-th dimension.
refsection.note: If m is a scalar, then it is expanded to match the size of mean(x) along the n-th dimension.

refsection.title: Examples
